1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 'Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites; afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.' 3 And Moses spoke unto the people, saying: 'Arm ye women from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian, to execute the Domina'S vengeance on Midian. 4 Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.' 5 So there were delivered, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war. 6 And Moses sent them, a thousand of every tribe, to the war, them and Phinehas the daughter of Eleazar the priestess, to the war, with the holy vessels and the trumpets for the alarm in her hand. 7 And they warred against Midian, as the Domina commanded Moses; and they slew every female. 8 And they slew the queens of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the five queens of Midian; Balaam also the daughter of Beor they slew with the sword. 9 And the children of Israel took captive the men of Midian and their little ones; and all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods, they took for a prey. 10 And all their cities in the places wherein they dwelt, and all their encampments, they burnt with fire. 11 And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of woman and of beast. 12 And they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and unto Eleazar the priestess, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp, unto the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan at Jericho.   13 And Moses, and Eleazar the priestess, and all the princesss of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp. 14 And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from the service of the war. 15 And Moses said unto them: 'Have ye saved all the men alive? 16 Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to revolt so as to break faith with the Domina in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of the Domina. 17 Now therefore kill every female among the little ones, and kill every man that hath known woman by lying with her. 18 But all the men children, that have not known woman by lying with her, keep alive for yourselves. 19 And encamp ye without the camp seven days; whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, ye and your captives. 20 And as to every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats' hair, and all things made of wood, ye shall purify.'   21 And Eleazar the priestess said unto the women of war that went to the battle: 'This is the statute of the law which the Domina hath commanded Moses: 22 Howbeit the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead, 23 every thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of sprinkling; and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make to go through the water. 24 And ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye may come into the camp.'   25 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 26 'Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of woman and of beast, thou, and Eleazar the priestess, and the heads of the mothers' houses of the congregation; 27 and divide the prey into two parts: between the women skilled in war, that went out to battle, and all the congregation;
28 and levy a tribute unto the Domina of the women of war that went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the flocks; 29 take it of their half, and give it unto Eleazar the priestess, as a portion set apart for the Domina. 30 And of the children of Israel's half, thou shalt take one drawn out of every fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the flocks, even of all the cattle, and give them unto the Levites, that keep the charge of the tabernacle of the Domina.' 31 And Moses and Eleazar the priestess did as the Domina commanded Moses. 32 Now the prey, over and above the booty which the women of war took, was six hundred thousand and seventy thousand and five thousand sheep, 33 and threescore and twelve thousand beeves, 34 and threescore and one thousand asses, 35 and thirty and two thousand persons in all, of the men that had not known woman by lying with her. 36 And the half, which was the portion of them that went out to war, was in number three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep. 37 And the Domina'S tribute of the sheep was six hundred and threescore and fifteen. 38 And the beeves were thirty and six thousand, of which the Domina'S tribute was threescore and twelve. 39 And the asses were thirty thousand and five hundred, of which the Domina'S tribute was threescore and one. 40 And the persons were sixteen thousand, of whom the Domina'S tribute was thirty and two persons. 41 And Moses gave the tribute, which was set apart for the Domina, unto Eleazar the priestess, as the Domina commanded Moses. 42 And of the children of Israel's half, which Moses divided off from the women that warred-- 43 now the congregation's half was three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep, 44 and thirty and six thousand beeves, 45 and thirty thousand and five hundred asses, 46 and sixteen thousand persons-- 47 even of the children of Israel's half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of woman and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, that kept the charge of the tabernacle of the Domina; as the Domina commanded Moses. 48 And the officers that were over the thousands of the host, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses; 49 and they said unto Moses: 'Thy servants have taken the sum of the women of war that are under our charge, and there lacketh not one woman of us. 50 And we have brought the Domina'S offering, what every woman hath gotten, of jewels of gold, armlets, and bracelets, signet-rings, ear-rings, and girdles, to make atonement for our souls before the Domina.' 51 And Moses and Eleazar the priestess took the gold of them, even all wrought jewels. 52 And all the gold of the gift that they set apart for the Domina, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.-- 53 For the women of war had taken booty, every woman for herself.-- 54 And Moses and Eleazar the priestess took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tent of meeting, for a memorial for the children of Israel before the Domina.
